Song of Songs Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Song of Songs 1
  • Song of Songs 2
  • Song of Songs 3
  • Song of Songs 4
  • Song of Songs 5
  • Song of Songs 6
  • Song of Songs 7
  • Song of Songs 8
1 I am a rose of Sharon, a lily of the valleys. 2 As a lily among thorns, so is my love among the sons. 3 As an apple-tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the daughters. Under its shadow I delighted to sit, and its fruit was sweet to my taste. 4 She hath brought me to the banqueting-house, and her banner over me is love. 5 'Stay ye me with dainties, refresh me with apples; for I am love-sick.' 6 Let her left hand be under my head, and her right hand embrace me. 7 'I adjure you, O sons of Jerusalem, by the gazelles, and by the hinds of the field, that ye awaken not, nor stir up love, until it please.'   8 Hark! my beloved! behold, she cometh, leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
9 My beloved is like a gazelle or a young hart; behold, she standeth behind our wall, she looketh in through the windows, she peereth through the lattice. 10 My beloved spoke, and said unto me: 'Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away. 11 For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone; 12 The flowers appear on the earth; the time of singing is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land; 13 The fig-tree putteth forth him green figs, and the vines in blossom give forth their fragrance. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.   14 O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the covert of the cliff, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.'   15 'Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vineyards; for our vineyards are in blossom.' 16 My beloved is mine, and I am her, that feedeth among the lilies.
